title: Equities
body: An equity is a type of instrument indicating its holder has proportionate ownership in the issuing company. In the FA Platform, the defining features of equities are that they are traded in integer units rather than fractions and are compatible with a number of transaction types (buy and sell, for example) and corporate actions (for example, dividends, exchanges, splits, and issues). This topic walks you through the processes of creating new equities, viewing and analysing existing equities, performing transactions on equities, and checking the equity-specific general configurations of the system.

title: Create equities
body: The following subsections describe the most important fields for creating an equity. Refer to Security window in FA Back Reference for detailed descriptions of the properties.

title: Security identifiers
body: The Code, ISIN code, and Trade code are all used when importing transactions for a security, import security prices, and in trading flows to link a security to trading connectors. It is up to you to choose which one you prefer to use, but the system also requires you to input a unique equity identifier in Code.

title: Security identifiers
body: ISIN code

title: Security identifiers
body: The ISIN code of the equity which identifies it on the market. The ISIN code, along with the trade code, is used to import transactions for a security, security prices, and in trading flows to link a security to trading connectors. To automatically fetch an update code for importing the equity price, you have to specify the ISIN code of your equity in the field and then click Update code 1-3 .

title: Security identifiers
body: Trade code

title: Security identifiers
body: Identifier of the equity in the market where you trade it. The trade code, along with the ISIN code, is used to import transactions for a security, security prices, and in trading flows to link a security to trading connectors. A trade code can be, for example, a Bloomberg ticker.

title: Security identifiers
body: Marketplace

title: Security identifiers
body: The market where the equity is traded. Options are defined in Preference → Securities → Market place.

title: Security identifiers
body: Update code 1-3

title: Security identifiers
body: Update codes for updating market prices for the equity, for example, Bloomberg code, Reuters code, or SIX code. The different update codes allow you to import and save market prices from different sources. The imported market prices are saved in the Market data info tab in Close 1-5 fields, based on the update codes defined. You can specify an update code manually in the field or fetch it using the ISIN code (fill in the ISIN code field and click on the Update code button).

title: Settlement place and date
body: Settlement place

title: Settlement place and date
body: Settlement place of the equity. Options are defined in Preference → Securities → Settlement place.

title: Settlement place and date
body: Holiday calendar and Settlement date offset determine which are business days and non-business days for your equity and how many days the equity takes to settle. To enable the calendar and settlement date offset, click the Enable settl. date checkbox.

title: Settlement place and date
body: Holiday calendar allows you to define the business days and non-business days for your equity to determine when trading occurs. The holiday calendar is used in transactions to calculate the settlement date.

title: Settlement place and date
body: Settl. date allows you to define how many days the equity takes to settle. The settlement date offset is taken into account when you enter a transaction for the equity.

title: Security analysis
body: Multiplier 1 and 2

title: Security analysis
body: Multipliers you can use to manipulate the unit price of the equity in the system. This can be useful if you have an equity valued in British pence, for example. In this case, you could input 100 in Multiplier 1 to divide the equity price so that it is calculated in pounds instead and input 1 in Multiplier 2 so that the price is shown in pounds as well.

title: Security analysis
body: Outstanding units and Votes per share

title: Security analysis
body: Outstanding units indicates the number of shares outstanding in the market. Votes per share indicates the number of votes per share for the equity owned. Outstanding units and Votes per share are used to calculate holdings and votes percentages per portfolio or customer in the Analytics+ view. They also allow you to generate a Notification of major holdings when the percentage goes above or below certain limits. This is useful if you need to report such changes to authorities.

title: Security analysis
body: Class 1-5

title: Security analysis
body: Security classifications defined in Preference. They can be, for example, the star rating, the risk level, or the Morningstar recommendation to buy, sell, or hold. The classes can be used to group securities in the Analytics+ view. If you want to group the equities in Analytics+ by their classes, assigning a class for all of your equities is important. Otherwise, the equities are just listed as "Other" in Analytics+.

title: Analyse equities
body: You can analyse equities the same way as other security types. You can find the full list of metrics in Analytics+.

title: Analyse equities
body: If you have assigned classifications to your equities, Analytics+ groups them for analysis. You could group your equities according to, for example, their star rating, risk level, or Morningstar recommendation. You can track the holding and vote percentages of your equities in the Analytics+ view using the Holding % and Votes % columns. You can use them to generate a Notification of major holdings if you need to report a change to the authorities.

title: Buy and sell equities, Run corporate actions with equities
body: Buy and sell equities, Run corporate actions with equities

The most common transactions for equities are buying (Buy,B) and selling (Sell,S). You can find the full list of transaction types available for equities in Transaction types for security transactions and in Transaction types for security transactions.
The most relevant corporate actions for equities are as dividends, splits, and issues. You can find the full list of corporate actions available in Corporate actions.

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: The Preference view contains the general configurations for equities in FA Back. Changing these settings is unnecessary because they are configured by default. The following configurations in Preference → Securities → Security types are important for equities.

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: Basic type

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: Must be STOCK in the case of equities. The basic types are hard coded into the system and determine the behavior of the instrument.

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: Decimal count

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: Equities cannot be traded in fractions, so the decimal count is 0.

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: Links to transaction types

title: View general configurations set for equities
body: For equities, the most common transaction types are buy and sell. There are also relevant Corporate actions such as dividends, splits, and issues that can be used for equities.

title: Provide credit to your clients
body: Portfolio credit is a feature that allows you to give credit to your clients using their portfolio holdings as collateral. The credit is calculated based on a percentage of the market value of the portfolio. The following sections describe the logic behind portfolio credit calculations and guide you through giving portfolio credit to a client.

title: Portfolio holdings as collateral for credit
body: The FA Platform calculates the collateral value of the portfolio, but the total amount of credit available to use is decided by you. The collateral value is based on all of the positions in the portfolio and can serve as guidance for your decision on the total amount of credit available to the client.

title: Portfolio credit calculation logic
body: The collateral value of a portfolio position is determined by multiplying the following values:

title: Portfolio credit calculation logic
body: Market value of the security.

title: Portfolio credit calculation logic
body: Collateral ratio of the security. Each security in the portfolio must have a defined collateral ratio for portfolio credit to be calculated.

title: Portfolio credit calculation logic
body: For example, if the collateral ratio of security A is 40% and its market value is 100,000 euros, and the collateral ratio of security B is 10% and its market value is 50,000 euros, the collateral value of the portfolio holdings is calculated as follows:

title: Define the credit amount for a portfolio
body: Define the credit amount for a portfolio

title: Add a credit account
body: To provide credit, create a credit account linked to the client's portfolio. In Portfolio window, Accounts tab, you can add a credit account:

title: Add a credit account
body: Click Add account.

title: Add a credit account
body: Enter the account information in the Accounts window that opens. Select Credit as the Account type. All fields in Portfolio window, Accounts tab are described in detail in Portfolio window.

title: Add a credit account
body: Click OK to save the changes.

title: Set collateral ratio for securities
body: You need to set a collateral ratio per security as a percentage of the security's market value. You can either set the collateral ratio in the Security window or import it in the CSV file. To set the collateral ratio in the Security window, open the Key figures tab:

title: Set collateral ratio for securities
body: Select Collateral ratio from the list of key figures on the left or add it as a new key figure by clicking Add new key figure.

title: Set collateral ratio for securities
body: Click Add new value.

title: Set collateral ratio for securities
body: Enter the collateral ratio as a percentage without the percent sign.

title: Set collateral ratio for securities
body: To import the collateral ratio in the CSV file, see File formats for importing securities and security prices.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: You can view the collateral value for the portfolio that the system has calculated and enter the total amount of credit you want to provide to your client in Portfolio window, Portfolio credit tab.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: To see how the collateral value is calculated:

title: Define portfolio credit
body: Open the Portfolio credit tab in the Portfolio window.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: Click the Show calculation details button to open the Calculation details window.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: The calculation details show you a table with the market value, collateral ratio, and collateral value of each security, and totals for each column in the bottom row.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: To define the amount of credit you want to provide and make available to your client:

title: Define portfolio credit
body: Enter the total amount of credit you want to assign to the portfolio in the Portfolio credit field. You can base this value on the collateral value for the portfolio.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: Click Save to save your changes.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: View the updated amount of credit available to your client under Available credit.

title: Define portfolio credit
body: After you give portfolio credit to your client, you can view the portfolio in Overview and see the credit account.

title: Related links
body: Authority reporting in FA Back reference

title: Tax reporting in Finland
body: Annual reporting for Finnish tax authorities package includes the following reports (for more information on report content, go to the Tax administration site):

title: Annual notification - Asset management fees (VSOMHOIE)
body: With this report, you can report fees from the management or custody of assets on a customer-by-customer basis in the format required by the Tax Administration.

title: Annual notification - Contact person (VSTVVYHT)
body: The report picks up the configured contact person information and arranges it according to the technical description.

title: Annual notification - Foreign dividends (VSULKOSE)
body: This annual notification report is for the Finnish tax authorities about foreign dividends.

title: Annual notification - Foreign dividends (VSULKOSE)
body: The report contains information on all the dividends from securities whose country code is not "FI".

title: Annual notification - Payments of interest, calling for withholding of tax at source (VSKTVYSL)
body: This report "Payments of interest, calling for withholding tax at source". Picking up these from the system is done by defining transaction types to look for, and then summed up of those transactions. Process will by default calculate the paid tax from transaction's tax fields including all tax types, but with configuration this can be narrowed to only selected tax types.

title: Annual notification - Payments of interest, calling for withholding of tax at source (VSKTVYSL)
body: The process currently supports only reporting of interest type 8B = Interest on bonds and debentures.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: This process creates an annual report of shares in funds and payments of interest.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: FA supports these types:

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2B and 2G. With these types, the fund management company can report units and income units from its own funds.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2D - Other interest or capital gains.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2E - Secondary market credit paid by the issuer of the annual return to the taxable person (taxable capital gains).

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2F - Post-market credit collected (received) by the issuer of the annual return from the taxable person (deduction in the taxable person's taxation).

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3J - Return paid on a unit of a foreign UCITS.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3K - Interest paid / transmitted outside the EU.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3L - Foreign UCITS share.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3M - Interest paid / transferred from another EU Member State.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: This report is for reporting purchases, sales, capital gains and losses for securities and derivatives. Role 1 reporting is transaction-based, while roles 2-4 are reported per owned securities.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: The FA supports the reporting of securities trading data with roles 1, 2, 3 and 4.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Reporting role 1 (reporting obligation of the securities intermediary) - the role reports all purchases and sales (excluding bonds, security type codes 07 and 57). The reporting obligation applies to both general and limited taxpayers in Finland.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Notifier role 2 (management company disclosure obligation) - the role is used to report redemptions under security type code 05.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Reporting role 3 (data for calculating gains and losses on disposals of securities) - the role is used to report sales (excluding bonds, security type codes 07, 45, 46 and 57). The obligation to notify applies to the sale of securities of natural persons and estates of taxable persons both in Finland in general and to a limited extent.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Notifier role 4 (instead of notifier role 3, obligation to declare bonds) - the role is used to report sales (including bonds, security type codes 07, 45, 46 and 57).

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If both notifier roles 3 and 4 are selected, notifier roles 3 report non-bond sales and notifier roles 4 report only bond sales.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If both notifier roles 1 and 4 are selected, no annual notification with notifier role 1 will be issued for sales reported with notifier role 4.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If both Advertiser Roles 1 and 3 are selected, then the same sales will be referenced

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: Contact information in Finnish tax reporting is based on information stored in the Finnish tax reporting tab on the Contact. This information can be filled in manually, or alternatively automatically propagated based on existing information under the Basic info and Address info tabs. If you wish to follow the automated approach, follow the steps below.

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: If you are not familiar with decision tables, first familiarise yourself with how Decision Tables work. For more information, see FA Developer guide: Business rules.

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: Download the decision table:

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: fa_contact_finnishTaxMapping.xlsx

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: Open it in Excel and make some selections based on how your data is structured. As a starting point there are two rules on rows 15 and 16, that are set to run for Contacts of type Customer (represented by the code 1, check the full list in Preference → Contacts → Contact types) and juridical forms Person and Company (full list of codes available in Preference → Contacts → Juridical form).

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: Depending on if your social security numbers or organization numbers are stored in External ID or Contact ID, put an X in either column F or G, but never both. Similarly depending on if names of private persons are saved in first name last name or last name first name format, put an X in column H or I. The logic assumes that the last name is either the first or last name in the Contact name under Contact Basic info. There is, however, special handling for last names starting with "af" or "von", so the prefix will be included in the last name, not first names.

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: The decision table fills in values for Contact type, Tax residence country code, Finnish person id or business id, Birth date, First name, Last name or company name, Street address, Street address2, City, Postal code and Country code. It is possible to leave out some values by removing the X from the relevant column. It is also possible to add a tag to mapped contacts when the rule is run by specifying the tag in column R.

title: Fill in Finnish tax details based on contact information
body: Follow the instructions in Create, deploy and verify a decision table under Step 2 to upload the Decision table and start utilizing the automatic filling rules.

title: Create an annual notification to the Finnish tax authorities
body: Create an annual notification to the Finnish tax authorities

title: Introduction
body: Introduction

title: Introduction
body: FA supports the generation of six different annual notification reports, that are used to report for example charged fees and profits to the Finnish tax authorities. After providing some background information, you can conveniently generate the reports directly in the correct format that the tax authorities expect.

title: Introduction
body: Supported reports

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE) is used to report details about security transactions. The report supports four different reporting roles (tax authority roles 1-4).

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - Asset management fees (VSOMHOIE) is used to report the asset management and custody fees collected from customers during the year.

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE) is used to report dividends and interests.

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - foreign dividends (VSULKOSE) is used to report transferred foreign dividends to persons resident in Finland.

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - Payments of interest, calling for withholding of tax at source (VSKTVYSL) is used to report interests that are subject to withholding tax.

title: Introduction
body: Annual notification - Return on interest payments, made to nonresident beneficiaries (VSRKOERI) is used to report yearly profits to persons that are not resident in Finland. Only payment type C4 (Annual investment-fund profits) is supported in the current reporting implementation.

title: Introduction
body: More details about the reports can be found from the tax authority.

title: Getting started
body: There is some data to enter on a report-by-report basis and something to put all in common for all reports. In this section, we first go through the common data, then the file-specific data.

title: General configuration
body: Define the general configurations for the reporting under Tools → Administer → Tax reporting → Finland

title: General configuration
body: Define the Payer identification (the business ID or social security number of the entity paying any withholding taxes - usually your business ID)

title: General configuration
body: Define the Contact person's name and phone number

title: General configuration
body: Define additional data identifier, such as branch code, for asset management fee report (VSOMHOIE), if relevant.

title: General configuration
body: Define tax types to include in the withholding of tax at source (VSKTVYSL) report.

title: General configuration
body: Define tax information in the Contact window (Finnish tax reporting tab) for all the contacts that are tax reportable.

title: General configuration
body: If you don't want to take the notification report for all the portfolios, it is a good idea to create an Annual notification group for the portfolios. When you build the tax reporting group, you can use for example tax country, juridical form, portfolio type and so on for portfolio group criteria to collect the relevant portfolios.

title: Annual Asset management fees report (VSOMHOIE)
body: If you need to specify an additional attribute (for example, office) for payments, you can do this from the general preferences (Tools → Administer → Tax reporting → Finland). If you don't add this, the system uses default since this is mandatory for this report.

title: Annual Asset management fees report (VSOMHOIE)
body: Make sure that your asset management transactions are added to the system (with types MFEE and PFEE).

title: Foreign dividends (VSULKOSE)
body: Make sure that a country is defined for all instruments that have paid dividends, no configurations needed.

title: Payments of interest, calling for withholding of tax at source (VSKTVYSL)
body: Make sure that all coupon payments are done with transaction type Coupon, COUP and withholding tax (WHT) is added to the coupon transactions. Also make sure that the required info is defined for all instruments that have paid coupons in tax reporting tab - no configurations needed.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: Transactions need to be tagged with the VSTVERIE tag (see above the classifications). Tagging can be done manually or automatically (see Automated transaction tagging). FA supports the following tags:

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2B and 2G. With these types, the fund management company can report units and income units from its own funds.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2D - Other interest or capital gains.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2E - Secondary market credit paid by the issuer of the annual return to the taxable person (taxable capital gains).

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 2F - Post-market credit collected (received) by the issuer of the annual return from the taxable person (deduction in the taxable person's taxation).

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3J - Return paid on a unit of a foreign UCITS or taxable capital income.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3K - Interest paid / transmitted outside the EU.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3L - Foreign UCITS share.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: 3M - Interest paid / transferred from another EU Member State.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: For all securities reported in VSTVERIE report, Classification must be selected under Finnish tax reporting tab in Security window.

title: Annual notification - Profits and shares (VSTVERIE)
body: For all fund securities reported in VSTVERIE report, Fund company business ID and Fund business ID must be filled in under Share class settings/Reporting tab in Security window.

title: Automated transaction tagging
body: You can use a decision table to assign transaction tags automatically. The decision table template below uses the transaction properties to define the correct VSTVERIE tag to use. You can use this template as is in most cases. The only thing to be modified (if needed) is the portfolio group filtering in column B. To filter by a group, add group code into column B.

title: Automated transaction tagging
body: Download decision table template

title: Automated transaction tagging
body: For more information about decision tables, see FA Developer guide: Business rules.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: FA supports reporting security transactions with roles 1, 2, 3 and 4.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Role 1 is used by brokers, role 2 by fund companies, role 3 to report the details required to calculate capital gains and role 4 for reporting details about bonds.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Reporting requirements of intermediaries in securities (role 1) reports all purchases and sales (excluding debt instruments with tax authority instrument code 07 and 57).

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Reporting requirements of managements of funds (role 2) reports fund redemptions (tax authority instrument code 05).

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Capital gains and capital losses (role 3) reports all the details related to sell transactions that are required to calculate capital gains (excluding bonds with tax authority instrument codes 07, 45, 46 and 57)

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Role 4 is used instead of role 3 in situations where the filer has fully ensured, to avoid double reporting, that the sales transaction will not be reported by any intermediary with role 1. The role reports all sales (including bonds bonds with tax authority instrument codes 07, 45, 46 and 57)

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: When multiple roles are selected, the following rules apply:

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If roles 3 and 4 are selected, role 3 is used for everything but bonds and role 4 only for bonds.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If roles 1 and 4 are selected, sells that are reported with role 4 are not reported at all with role 1.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If roles 1 and 3 are selected, the same sell transactions are reported with the same reference in both roles.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: In order to report the transactions correctly, you need to classify your securities according to the classification used by the tax authorities. This can be done either using the Class 3 field or by selecting the class in the Finnish tax reporting tab on the security:

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: If you wish to use the Class 3 field, follow these steps:

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: Define this classification to the instruments by selecting the relevant Class 3 field value

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: To exclude transactions from VSAPUUSE reporting, use the tag "VSAPUUSE_exclude". This will exclude the transactions when reporting in role 1, and with roles 2, 3 and 4 portfolio position information linked and tagged sell transaction are excluded.

title: Annual notification - Purchases and sales (VSAPUUSE)
body: NOTE: Roles 3 and 4. As sometimes the real purchase values are not known, or are given by the end client, this can be indicated in the report in field 165. Field value defaults to 2, and can be overwritten with purchase transaction tag: VSAPUUSE165-Client supplied information (1),VSAPUUSE165-Not known (3)

title: Return on interest payments made to nonresident beneficiaries (VSRKOERI)
body: Make sure that all securities that the dividends are paid for have security classification. Only classes 05 and 55 are reported with this report. There are two ways to set the classification.

title: Return on interest payments made to nonresident beneficiaries (VSRKOERI)
body: Set the classification in Finnish tax reporting tab in the Security window. This is the preferred way and will overwrite the Class 3 -method below if both are set.

title: Return on interest payments made to nonresident beneficiaries (VSRKOERI)
body: Set the Class 3 field value in the Security window.

title: Annual Asset Management Fees report (VSOMHOIE)
body: Go to the Portfolios view.

title: Annual Asset Management Fees report (VSOMHOIE)
body: To limit the report to a specific portfolio group, select the group.

title: Annual Asset Management Fees report (VSOMHOIE)
body: Open the report from Tax reporting → Finland → Asset management fees (VSOMHOIE).

title: Annual Asset Management Fees report (VSOMHOIE)

title: Calculate ASK tax status
body: In general, the tax status of an ASK account is calculated only when the account is reported to authorities. In some cases, if the tax status information is needed on a daily basis or if there were changes in the historical transactions, the status is calculated more frequently.

title: Calculate ASK tax status
body: To calculate the status on request or based on a schedule, use the Recalculate ASK tax status tool. This tool allows you to calculate tax status separately and stores the information in the Portfolio window , Tax reporting (NO) - ASK tab. When the calculation is done for a portfolio, the ASK tax status-Recalculate tag is changed to ASK tax status-Calculated. You can use the ASK tax status-Recalculate tag to filter out the portfolios that need to be calculated.

title: One-time calculations
body: One-time calculations

title: One-time calculations
body: To run the calculation:

title: One-time calculations
body: Open the Portfolios view and choose the portfolios you want to include in the calculation.

title: One-time calculations
body: Click Tax reporting → Norway → Calculate ASK tax status. The calculation starts in the background immediately.

title: One-time calculations
body: View the calculation result. Open the Tasks view and find the ASK calculation completed successfully <datetime> task, where <datetime> is the date and time when the calculation was completed.

title: Scheduled calculations
body: Scheduled calculations

title: Scheduled calculations
body: To schedule the calculations, follow the general instructions in Scheduling. The process is called ASK recalculation in the scheduling view.

title: Introduction
body: FA supports the generation of five different reports in XML format. After providing the background information, you can generate the reports directly in the format that the tax authorities expect.

title: Introduction
body: Supported reports:

title: Introduction
body: Aksjesparekonto, ASK, used to report share saving accounts.

title: Introduction
body: Finansprodukter, used to report holdings in foreign securities.

title: Introduction
body: Individuellepensjonsordninger, IPS, used to report pension saving accounts.

title: Introduction
body: Saldorente, used to report account balances and received interests.

title: Introduction
body: Verdipapirfond and Verdipapirfondshistorikk, used to report holdings in Norwegian funds.

title: Introduction
body: More details about the reports can be found from the Norwegian tax administration (see Related links).

title: Getting started
body: Before you can run the reports, you need to set the reporting parameters and fill in tax information for entities to be reported.

title: Getting started
body: Define general configurations for the reporting under Tools → Administer → Tax reporting → Norway.

title: Getting started
body: Reporting organization:

title: Getting started
body: Name – Full name of the reporting organization.

title: Getting started
body: Identification number – Tax identification number of the reporting organization.

title: Getting started
body: GIIN (optional) – Global Intermediary Identification Number of the reporting organization.

title: Getting started
body: Contact person:

title: Getting started
body: Name

title: Getting started
body: Email address

title: Getting started
body: Phone number

title: Getting started
body: Mobile phone number

title: Getting started
body: Reporting parameters:

title: Getting started
body: Tax-shield rate – List of yearly values for skjermingsrente. Semi-colon separated list of key-value pairs. For example 2018=1.2;2019=2.3. Use dot as decimal separator in the value part.

title: Getting started
body: Stock part factor – List of yearly values for aksjeandel. Semi-colon separated list of key-value pairs. For example 2018=0.1;2019=0.2. Use dot as decimal separator in the value part.

title: Getting started
body: These yearly values must be updated for each report year. Report cannot be run for years that doesn't have values defined. Values are provided by the tax administration.

title: Getting started
body: ASK reporting:

title: Getting started
body: Include fees – Choose if fees should be included in the generated report. If the checkbox is selected, fees are included in the report.

title: Getting started
body: Enable sub-portfolios – Choose if ASK account can consist of one master portfolio and sub-portfolios. If the checkbox is checked, sub-portfolios are aggregated into the master portfolio in the generated report.

title: Getting started
body: Saldorente reporting:

title: Getting started
body: Don't report accounts with negative balance – Choose if accounts with a negative balance should be reported. If the checkbox is checked, accounts with a negative balance are not included in the report.

title: Getting started
body: Verdipapirfond reporting:

title: Getting started
body: Create history file together with the reporting year file – Choose if the history file, Verdipapirfondshistorikk, should be created together with the regular report file. If the checkbox is selected, history file is created.

title: Getting started
body: Exclude fees from client report – Choose if fees should be excluded from the client report. If checkbox is checked, fees are not included in the client report.

title: Getting started
body: Fill in the tax information in the Tax reporting (NO) tab under Contact window for all contacts that are included in the reporting.

title: Getting started
body: Required fields for individuals

title: Getting started
body: Last name

title: Getting started
body: First name

title: Getting started
body: ID

title: Getting started
body: Country code ISO-3166

title: Getting started
body: Birth date (yyyy-mm-dd)

title: Getting started
body: Required fields for organisations

title: Getting started
body: Last name

title: Getting started
body: ID

title: Getting started
body: Optional fields

title: Getting started
body: Reseller - Select if this contact is a reseller.

title: Getting started
body: Association - Select if this contact is an association.

title: Getting started
body: Undocumented account - Select if the account is undocumented.

title: Getting started
body: Account closed - Select if the account is closed.

title: Getting started
body: No tax shield allowed - Select if this contact is not allowed to any skjerming.

title: Getting started
body: Managers - Contacts managing this particular contact. Information is entered as semi-colon separated list of Contact ID's, and all of these contacts must be found in the same system with valid tax information.

title: Getting started
body: Addresses - Address(es) to be reported. Address entry is formed of two parts, country code and the address. Country code is given in ISO Alpha-2 format and address is printed as it's entered. If reporting several addresses, address block are separated by semicolon and therefor address cannot contain semicolons. Example: FI|Kotikatu 1, 00100 Helsinki, Finland;SE|Hemväg 1, 1234 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Getting started
body: International TIN's - Tax identification numbers to be reported. TIN entry is formed of three parts, country code, TIN type and TIN number. Country code is given in ISO Alpha-2 format and TIN type can be either TIN or GIIN. Multiple TINs are separated by semicolon. Example: FI|TIN|020280-123T;SE|TIN|19800202123T

title: Getting started
body: International reportings - Account types for international reporting. International reporting entry is formed of two parts, country code and account owner type. Country code is in ISO Alpha-2 format and account owner type can be one of the following: FATCA102, FATCA103, FATCA104, CRS101, CRS102, CRS103. Multiple values are separated by semicolon. Example: FI|CRS101

title: Getting started
body: Beneficial owners - Beneficial owners of the company (organisations only). Owner block has two parts, Contact ID and rights type. Contact ID is only one value, but rights type can have multiple values. Rights type has two parts separated by equals character. Rights type first part is country code in ISO Alpha-2 format and second part is comma separated list. For beneficial owners to be reported correctly, tax information of the owner must be correctly filled in. Example: CONTACTID|NL=CRS801;CONTACTID|NL=CRS805

title: Getting started
body: Fill in the tax information in the Tax reporting (NO) tab in the Security window for all securities.

title: Getting started

title: Getting started

title: Getting started

title: Getting started

title: Getting started
body: Fund manager's SSN - Fund securities only, organisation number of the fund manager if the information is available.

title: Getting started
body: GIIN code - Fund securities only, Global Intermediary Identification Number of the fund if the information is available.

title: Getting started

title: Getting started
body: Report type - This applies only to Finansprodukter reporting, select OFP if security should be reported in Finansprodukter report.

title: Getting started
body: Instrument type - This applies to Verdipapirfond and Finansprodukter reports. Select the type of the instrument.

title: Getting started

title: Getting started

title: Getting started
body: Yearly stock allocation - List of yearly stock allocation values. Semi-colon separated list of key-value pairs. Example: 2019=0.1;2020=0.2

title: Getting started
body: Yearly RISK - List of yearly RISK values. Semi-colon separated list of key-value pairs. Example: 2004=20.1;2005=20.2

title: Report-specific preparations
body: In addition to the general configurations, some of the reports have individual options to be set and practicalities to take care of.

title: ASK
body: To generate a valid ASK report, you need to set Account type for all reported accounts in Tax reporting (NO)/ASK tab in the Portfolio window.

title: Excluding transactions
body: There can be situations when transactions in the portfolio should not be included in the reporting. In these cases, it's possible to exclude them from the report by using the "Norwegian tax-Exclude" transaction tag.

title: Account structure with sub-portfolios
body: If ASK reporting - Enable sub-portfolios option is selected in general configuration, make sure the portfolio setup is correct. Parent portfolio must be empty, and the report is run against the parent.

title: Account structure with sub-portfolios
body: While the report does the ASK tax status calculations each time the report is run, for performance reasons it will use the result of old calculations as the starting point. If there are changes in the historical transactions, full recalculations should be done before report is run, or the History data (do not edit) field on Tax reporting (NO)/ASK tab in the Portfolio window should be emptied.

title: Finansprodukter
body: To generate Finansprodukter report, you need to select the securities that are included in the report. To do this, set the Reporting type to OFP in the Tax reporting (NO) tab in the Security window.

title: Mergers and share class changes
body: See Mergers and share class changes under Verdipapirfond.

title: Transferred assets
body: In some cases, transferred holdings do not have exact values available on the report date, and these cases must be reported differently. To flag these kind of transactions, they must be tagged with tag Zero profit in Finansprodukter report. If this tag is present in any of the transactions for a security in customer's portfolio within reporting period, profit for this customer/security combination is reported as 0 and there is no shield (skjerming) usage reported.

title: Excluding transactions
body: There can be situations when transactions in the portfolio should not be included in the reporting. In these cases, it's possible to exclude them from the report by using the Norwegian tax-Exclude transaction tag.

title: IPS
body: To generate a valid IPS report, you need to set Agreement number, Agreement type and Withdrawal for all reported portfolios in Tax reporting (NO)/IPS tab in the Portfolio window.

title: Excluding transactions
body: There can be situations when transactions in the portfolio should not be included in the reporting. In these cases, it's possible to exclude them from the report by using transaction tag Norwegian tax-Exclude.

title: Saldorente
body: To generate a valid Saldorente report, you need to set the Account type in Tax reporting (NO)/Balance and interest tab in Portfolio window.

title: Verdipapirfond
body: Verdipapirfond doesn't have any additional required steps, but there are some special cases that might require attention.

title: Excluding transactions
body: There can be situations when transactions in the portfolio should not be included in the reporting. In these cases, it's possible to exclude them from the report by using transaction tag Norwegian tax-Exclude.

title: Dividends on subscription date
body: In some cases, there is a possibility that fund units subscribed on the day X are also entitled to dividend on that same day X. If the subscribed units are entitled to same day dividend, add the Same day dividend tag to the subscription transaction. This way the units will be taken into account when the dividends are calculated.

title: Dividends in bond fund
body: Dividends in bond funds are reported separately in the Verdipapirfond report. Reported value consists of bought and sold interest, accrual, and dividends within the reporting period. Reported value cannot be negative, and negative accrual should be handled in advance with value adjustment transactions. Technically it should go so that the first purchase lot of the fund in question is adjusted with the full negative value before reporting. For example, if the negative accrual is -500 and size of the first purchase lot is 10, adjustment transaction should have trade amount of -500, amount 10 and unit price -50.

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: When assets are acquired or realized, the type is important from the taxation point of view. Default types are regular buy (kjoep) and regular realization (vanligRealisasjon), and they are used in report unless type is se to be something else. Type can be set with a transaction tag, and there are following options available under Norwegian tax tag:

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Inheritance/gift (arvGaveTilAndreEnnEktefelleEllerSamboer)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Inheritance/gift to partner (arvGaveTilEktefelleEllerSamboer)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Non taxable realization (ikkeSkattbarRealisasjon)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Transfer (overfoering)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Divorce (skilsmisse)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Undivided estate (uskifte)

title: Acquisition and realization types
body: Move to ASK (this is for transfer transactions when asset is moved to ASK portfolio)

title: Mergers and share class changes
body: For mergers and share class changes to be reported correctly, they need to use corresponding transaction types: MRG for mergers and EXCH for share class changes. There should be one MRG/EXCH transaction per purchase lot, they cannot be aggregated into one.

title: Mergers and share class changes
body: Due to the fact that the FIFO is recalculated on the contact level for the reporting, you might need to add transaction priorities for transactions happening the same day as merge and/or share class change to keep them in correct order from client's point of view.

title: Generating XML reports
body: To generate a report:

title: Generating XML reports
body: Navigate to the Portfolios view and choose the portfolios to include in the report.

title: Generating XML reports
body: If you are for example reporting ASK accounts, choose only ASK portfolios (and only master portfolios in sub-portfolio setup)

title: Generating XML reports
body: To make it easier to report, you can create groups to have portfolios grouped by report type.

title: Generating XML reports
body: Click Tax reporting → Norway → Generate report. The Reporting parameters window appears.

title: Generating XML reports
body: Enter reporting parameters:

title: Generating XML reports
body: Report type – Type of the report to generate

title: Generating XML reports
body: Reporting scope (only for type Verdipapirfond) – Select whether the scope should be customer reporting or reseller reporting

title: Generating XML reports
body: Reporting year – The year to be reported

title: Generating XML reports
body: Click Continue. The View files window shows generated files. The filename consists of report type name, reporting year and running sequence number. If there are errors in the report, the error files are attached.

title: Generating XML reports
body: Complete the process by clicking Cancel or Done. If you click Cancel, the sequence number is not saved and the next report will be generated with the same sequence number.

title: Introduction
body: According to Norwegian regulations, investors need to be informed of the data that has been reported to the tax authorities on their behalf. Therefore, after authority reporting is done (in XML format), clients must be provided with the same information. Unlike the authority reporting, the client reporting is done with PDF reports.

title: Generating report
body: Each report is run for the entire reporting year at once. Generating the report gathers the data on-the-fly the same way that the authority report does. This means that data changes done after authority reporting and before client reporting may lead to discrepancies in these reports.

title: Generating report
body: Click Tools → New report and choose one of the client reports:

title: Generating report

title: Generating report
body: Standard Norwegian IPS report.

title: Generating report
body: Standard Norwegian tax fee report.

title: Generating report
body: Standard Norwegian tax fund report – the Verdipapirfond client report.

title: Generating report
body: Standard Norwegian tax report for foreign stocks and bonds – the Finansprodukter client report.

title: Generating report

title: Generating report
body: Report date, use the last day of the report year.

title: Generating report
body: Language.

title: Generating report
body: Output type.

title: Generating report
body: Click Generate report.

title: Generating report
body: The generated report is either downloaded or opened directly depending on your browser settings.

After providing the background information, you can generate the reports directly in the correct format that the tax authorities expect.

title: Transaction-level exceptions
body: In some situations, it is necessary to have separate handling for selected transactions.  FA supports the following exceptions on the transaction level:

title: Transaction-level exceptions
body: Move to ISK, transfer of assets from non-ISK account to ISK account. Supported in KU21, KU32, KU40.

title: Transaction-level exceptions
body: Exclude, transfer of assets from ISK account to another ISK account. Supported only in KU30.

title: Transaction-level exceptions
body: To mark transactions for this handling, tag them with corresponding tag: KU-Move to ISK or KU-Exclude.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Cancellations (also called removals) of KU reports are needed if incorrect data was reported to Swedish tax authorities. If that happens, the steps to fix the situation are as follows:

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Generate a cancellation file. This file indicates to the tax authorities that previously reported data with the given identifiers is incorrect, and should be removed from the tax office's records.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Send the cancellation file to the tax authorities.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Fix the underlying data that caused the problem (this can be done earlier as well).

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Re-generate the report for the problematic data in particular, now that the data has been corrected.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Send the re-generated report.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: This guide only handles Step 1 of the above workflow. Step 4 is covered in Create KU reports to Swedish tax authorities, and the other steps are manual. This guide may also be used to browse what data has been reported to the tax authorities for the selected portfolios and year.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Generate cancellation files

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Navigate to Portfolios view and select the portfolios to be included.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click Tax reporting→ Sweden → KU report cancellations.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Select the reporting year for which cancellations are created. It defaults to the previous year.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click Done. You will see a row for every reported item associated with the selected portfolios.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: To create cancellations, choose one or more rows and click Create cancellations.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Cancel everything (for the selected portfolios/year)

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click on the checkbox in the top-left corner. This selects every visible row, which is everything if you haven't applied any filters.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click Create cancellations.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Cancel all rows of a specific type

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Enter a filter which leaves the rows that should be cancelled. For example, Type filter KU31 to remove only reported dividends, or Report Generation Time 2021-02-17 to target reports that were generated on that date.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click the checkbox in the top-left corner. This selects every visible row.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Click Create cancellations.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: Once cancellations are created, you will see the Dowload and approve cancellations report window:

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: If there are validation errors, the validationErrors.txt file is available for download, and the feedback text is different.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: If there are no validation errors, you can download the kured-cancellations.xml file and send it to the tax authorities. After doing that, click Done to update FA records of outstanding KU reports.

title: Create KU cancellations to Swedish tax authorities
body: This process does not automatically send the generated cancellation file anywhere. You need to download the file and send it yourself.

title: View/analyze what was reported to the tax authorities
body: View/analyze what was reported to the tax authorities

title: View/analyze what was reported to the tax authorities
body: You can safely run the cancellation process as defined above, and take an excel export of the content without actually creating any cancellations. Click Cancel once you're done on Step 3, instead of Create cancellations. Note that the excel export doesn't care about what rows were selected.

title: Generate reports for transactions and trade orders
body: You can generate reports for selected transactions or trade orders. For example, if you need to report transactions that result from trade order execution, or all today's transactions or trade orders. Depending on how often you need to produce the report, you can use one of the options:

title: Generate reports for transactions and trade orders
body: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search. This option is convenient if you need to produce the report only once.

title: Generate reports for transactions and trade orders
body: Generate reports based on the saved search. This option is convenient if you need to generate reports more than once – for example, if you need to report all today's buy transactions every day. You can also schedule report generation.

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: To generate reports for transactions or trade orders based on a search:

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: Define the report scope:

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: Search for transactions in the Overview (lower section) or in the Transactions view.

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: Search for trade orders in the Trade orders view.

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: Click the printer icon in the top-right corner of the view and choose the report options in the Report window that opens (see Report window in FA Back reference for details).

title: Generate reports based on an ad-hoc search
body: Click Generate report.

title: Generate reports based on the saved search
body: To generate reports for transactions or trade orders based on the saved search:

title: Generate reports based on the saved search
body: Open Transactions or Trade orders view, define the search criteria, and save the search (see Saving search views in FA Back reference for details).

title: Generate reports based on the saved search
body: Click the printer icon in the top-right corner of the view. In the Report window that opens, select the report and report options. In the Saved search field, choose the search you created in the previous step.

title: Generate reports based on the saved search
body: To schedule the report generation, click Add schedule and follow the steps in Schedule reports.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: You can automatically maintain an up-to-date list of transactions or trade orders that need to be reported and those that have already been reported. For example, this is convenient if you send out transaction or trade order confirmations to your clients. To set up this feature, you need to create tags, for example, "Confirmation sent" and "Confirmation pending". Then, set up the system to generate reports for the pending transactions or trade orders and replace the tag after reports are ready.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: Create tags for transactions and trade orders in Preference view. For example, you can create a tag called "Confirmation pending" for transactions and trade orders that are awaiting report generation and a tag called "Confirmation sent" for transactions and trade orders that have already been reported. For detailed instructions on creating tags, see Preference - Tags.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: Create two saved searches in the Transactions or Trade orders view for the transactions or trade orders and use the tags you just created as a search filter. All new transactions or trade orders with the specified tag are added to this view. To learn how to save search views, see Saving search views.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: Click the printer icon in the top-right corner of the view for pending transaction or trade orders to create a new report.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: Select the search view you saved in the Saved search field and add the tag to be automatically applied after the report is generated in the Transaction tags or Trade order tags field. For example, you can enter the "Confirmation sent" tag here.

title: Mark transactions and trade orders as reported with tags
body: After you complete these steps, generating the report automatically applies the new tag to transactions or trade orders for which reports have been sent out.

title: Ex-post costs and charges
body: Ex-post costs and charges

title: View ex-post costs and charges
body: The FA Platform provides you with a report showing the breakdown of realized costs and charges in the portfolio according to their ESMA classification: One-off charges, ongoing charges, transaction charges, ancillary services, incidental costs, third-party payments, and other costs. Costs and charges are grouped by investment services, financial Instruments, and total costs and charges. In addition, the report shows the return of the portfolio (TWR) before and after costs and charges.

title: View ex-post costs and charges
body: The report requires that all applicable transaction and cost types are categorized according to ESMA classifications and that securities have ex-post costs defined.

title: Getting started
body: Getting started

title: Ex-post figures in FA
body: Ex-post figures in FA

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: The figures are available in the Analytics+ view and are based on ex-post-cost categorization.

title: Third-party payments logic
body: Regulations require listing third-party payments separately from other costs, meaning we cannot consider them a part of the security fees. The report handles this by picking up all third-party payments and adding those to the portfolio costs. However, the third-party payments are NOT included in the total figures. This is because including kickbacks in the total figures would lead to counting them twice: once as security costs and again as kickbacks.

title: Third-party payments logic
body: In practice, third-party payments should be managed with two kinds of transactions:

title: Third-party payments logic
body: Kickbacks which are configured similarly to a dividend (i.e. adds cash, adds return etc.), and categorized under security costs (e.g. ongoing costs)

title: Third-party payments logic
body: Un-distributed kickbacks, which are configured to have no effect on anything (except for FIFO effect), but categorized under third-party payments (e.g. ongoing costs)

title: Third-party payments logic
body: Transactions should be added to portfolios corresponding to the amount of kickbacks that belong to the portfolio but were not distributed. Note that these transactions must currently be entered against a position in the portfolio; entering un-distributed kickbacks as "cash" transactions does not work currently (FA 3.4.15, 3.6.0).

title: Third-party payments logic
body: Kickbacks paid back to the end users effectively reduce the fees associated with securities they came from. This can be achieved with transaction type 1.

title: Getting the ex-post report
body: When you have added an ex-post categorisation for your costs and installed the ex-post report, you can generate it in the report window.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: The report uses ex-post costs for the wrong date. I entered 2018 costs for the report for 2018-12-31, since that is when they were confirmed, but it uses the 2017-12-31 costs for 2018 reporting.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: Ex-post costs are indeed confirmed retroactively. You get the final ex-post cost figures for 2018 at the very end of the year or sometime in January 2019. You have to record ex-post costs on the date when they enter into effect, not when the figures are confirmed. Ex-post costs always have a time period they are calculated from and we need to use the starting date.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: If an ex-post cost figure is valid from 2018-01-01 - 2018-12-31, it has to be entered as an ex-post costs row on 2018-01-01. If there are any existing ex-cost rows within that time period, those all have to be updated with the cost in question.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: Report calculations take these into account by finding the most recent (relative to the daily position being calculated) security ex-post cost percentages when it calculates the daily values for positions. If a security has ex-post costs of X entered for 2018-01-01, and costs of Y entered for 2018-07-01, it uses costs X for the first half of the year and costs Y from that point forward (for that security). The standard extensions of the FA Platform for importing cost information take this into account.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: If you entered the ex-post costs for 2018-01-01, but the report is still showing costs from 2017, then you probably have to recalculate the reports of the portfolios containing this security (see question below).

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: I entered ex-post costs for my security, but they do not show up in the report.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: Check whether you entered them for the correct date. See above for an explanation of what the correct date is.

title: Questions about ex-post costs and charges
body: If the correct date was entered, did you remember to recalculate reports for the portfolios that contain this security? You have to do so because ex-post data is included in the daily report calculations and updating this information into the securities does not automatically cause the reports to be recalculated.

title: Create your own ex-post classification for costs
body: Create your own ex-post classification for costs
The ex-post report requires a classification of fees. The FA system does not have this default classification because different actors interpret it differently.

title: Investment service costs
body: All costs and associated charges for the investment service(s) and/or ancillary services provided to the end client should form a part of the amount to be disclosed. Cost items should be aggregated as per the first column in Annex II of the MIFID II Delegated Regulation table below. This table refers to both Ex-Ante and Ex-Post disclosures.

title: Investment service costs
body: All costs and associated charges for the investment service(s) and/or ancillary services provided to the end client should form a part of the amount to be disclosed. Cost items should be aggregated as per the first column in Annex II of the MIFID II Delegated Regulation table below. This table refers to both Ex-Ante and Ex-Post disclosures.

title: Investment product costs
body: All costs and associated charges related to the financial instrument that form a part of the amount to be disclosed. Cost items should be aggregated as per the first column in Annex II of the MIFID II Delegated Regulation table below. This table refers to both Ex-Ante and Ex-Post disclosures.

title: Investment product costs
body: It is a requirement to show the aggregated totals of product, service, and third-party payments received. These figures must be shown as both a percentage amount and a monetary figure.

title: Set up cost at the security level
body: Configure the investment product ex-ante and ex-post costs in the Security window, Cost info tab. For more information, see Ex-ante / Ex-post costs in FA Back reference.

title: Set up cost type for cost transaction
body: Each transaction type with a negative profit effect should be mapped in the transaction type configuration to one of the five ex-post investment service cost types (see table above).

title: Enter the cost classification of the fee transaction
body: Each transaction cost type should be mapped in the transaction type configuration to one of the five ex-post investment service cost types.

title: Scheduling
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: Create a form
body: To create a form:

title: Create a form
body: Go to the Forms view in the FA Developer app and click Add form.

title: Create a form
body: Choose a form component (for example, Text Field) from the component list on the left side and move it to the form component area.

title: Create a form
body: Give the form component a Label to differentiate it from other components.

title: Create a form
body: Define a Property Name in the element's API tab. It is used to identify the field in the collected data for each element. See Define form components to import data in FA.

title: Create a form
body: Enter the form name to differentiate it in the List of forms in the Forms view and click Save form.

title: Create a form
body: After saving, you can find the form in the Forms view. You can now use the form in a process: see Display a form.

title: Contacts view
body: The Contacts view allows you to search for contacts saved in the system. You can perform a completely new contact search, or use the contact search creteria saved earlier. The Contacts view also allows you to export the data as XLS or PDF or generate a report from the search view.

title: Searching for contacts
body: The Contacts view allows you to search for contacts. You can:

title: Searching for contacts
body: Quick search by typing in your search criteria into the available field.

title: Searching for contacts
body: Click "Show all" and search through filtering.

title: Searching for contacts
body: "Show extended search" and define your search criteria in the available fields.

title: Searching for contacts
body: Access one of the saved search tabs to do a pre-defined search.

title: Searching for contacts
body: The contacts found are listed in the table.

title: Searching for contacts
body: You can also save the search for later use as a new tab in the Contacts view. Saving the search saves the search criteria, and the search with the search criteria is conducted again every time the saved search is opened.

title: Viewing the contacts in the table
body: The columns show the contact information you store in the system, as well as the created and last modified dates.

title: Viewing the contacts in the table
body: To choose which columns you want to use, click in the upper-right corner of the screen. To sort the contacts, click the column headers: the arrow next to the column header indicates that the contacts are ordered based on the values in that column.

title: Viewing the contacts in the table
body: Double-clicking a contact from the search result opens the contact information in the Contact window for viewing and editing.

title: Processes
body: In addition, you can perform different processes against the contacts searched on the Contacts view. These processes are shown on the bottom of the Contacts view as buttons. These processes are always started against a contact search: the processes affect the contacts searched on the view.

title: Processes
body: Processes configured against "contacts" are visible at the bottom of the Contacts view.

title: Securities view

title: Searching for securities

title: Searching for securities

title: Searching for securities

title: Searching for securities

title: Searching for securities

These processes are always started against a security search: the processes affect the securities searched on the view.
